snippet: With 98.37 points, Patrick Chan of Canada, the two-time defending champion, shattered the high-score record for the short program by more than 3 points at the world championships.
abstract: Canadian figure skater Patrick Chan shatters high-score record for short program at world championships in London, scoring 98.37 points.
lead_paragraph: With 98.37 points, Patrick Chan of Canada, the two-time defending champion, shattered the high-score record for the short program by more than 3 points at the world championships.

headline.seo: Chan Sets Scoring Record in Short Program
headline.main: Chan Sets Scoring Record in Short Program
